summary: The concept of "space science" encompasses the systematic study of celestial phenomena and the application of scientific principles to understand the universe. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, space science plays a pivotal role in shaping policies related to space exploration, satellite technology, and environmental monitoring. The European Space Agency (ESA) collaborates with EU institutions to promote research and innovation in this field, ensuring compliance with international treaties and regulations. Furthermore, space science informs strategic decisions on sustainable development and technological advancements, thereby contributing to the EU's overarching goals of scientific excellence and environmental stewardship.
